result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason W Castillo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason W Castillo is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason W Castillo was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall pay fine including costs at a rate of $50/mo commencing 12/1/15 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full or serve not beyond 20 days in the Dodge County Jail consecutive with huber and transfer
Consecutive to: Sentence shall commence on or before Court ordered start date;  with work release and transfer privileges; may serve sentence in different stages - not all at once

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason W Castillo

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: (1:09) Defendant Jason W Castillo in court with attorney Joseph Francis Fischer. Intern Kevin Schmidt (Barrington) appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Fischer heard on Def.'s FTA and attempts to get Def. into court on this authorized warrant; State heard on bond; Court orders: $1,000 PA Bond Reinstated; PH 9/10/15 at 1:30pm in Br. 3; warrant quashed

Defendant Jason W Castillo not in court. Prosecuting Atty Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer in court for Defendant Jason W Castillo and heard on def's FTA for prelim hrg; court authorizes warrant and stays it to 12:45 on 8/24/15  Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 12:45 pm.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

10:37 - Defendant Jason W Castillo in court with attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Atty Fischer enters Not Guilty plea. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
for Cont. - UNSIGNED; never rec'd via e-file
DA's office said a continuance was signed by their office and "filed"; nothing rec'd in this office; DA approves to change time to 10:30am
